intro: Ampelocissus rupicola, commonly known as the rock fig or rock grape, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, fig-like fruits. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Ampelocissus rupicola is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in rocky environments.
